intro: Weinmannia sanguisugarum, commonly known as the red-veined weinmannia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features striking red veins on its leaves, which give it its common name and contribute to its ornamental value. It typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Weinmannia sanguisugarum is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal in gardens and botanical collections.
